commit.message:
Fix authmethod check by printing a warning message when CHAP used and authmethod=None (#443)

* Fix indentation in usr/initiator.c

I just happened upon this code, and had to fix
the indentation-by-spaces. No functional change.

* Warn users of login authorization failure.

Currently, during session establishment, CHAP credentials
are sent, if needed, but any errors doing so are ignored.

Start paying attention to authorization failure. For now, we
will just print a warning message that this behavior is being
deprecated. Some day this should actually be fixed.

* Fix wording on deprecated warning for auth failures.

* Warn when authmethod=None but CHAP credentials set

Print a warning message that we are using CHAP even
though authmethod is unset, or set to None, and that
this is being deprecated "some day".

* Updated iscsid.conf on how "authmethod" attribute used

Just adding comments about authmethod being mostly ignored.
No functional change.

* Add comment for deprecated authmethod handling.

Just added a "FIXNE" comment, to be consistent.

verification.payload:
tree 801134942f0839ae5bf54a366fd884baa9ff50e3
parent 48e683c858fa3495aa80402572e1878d057d0399
author Lee Duncan <lduncan@suse.com> 1712079865 -0700
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1712079865 -0700

Fix authmethod check by printing a warning message when CHAP used and authmethod=None (#443)

* Fix indentation in usr/initiator.c

I just happened upon this code, and had to fix
the indentation-by-spaces. No functional change.

* Warn users of login authorization failure.

Currently, during session establishment, CHAP credentials
are sent, if needed, but any errors doing so are ignored.

Start paying attention to authorization failure. For now, we
will just print a warning message that this behavior is being
deprecated. Some day this should actually be fixed.

* Fix wording on deprecated warning for auth failures.

* Warn when authmethod=None but CHAP credentials set

Print a warning message that we are using CHAP even
though authmethod is unset, or set to None, and that
this is being deprecated "some day".

* Updated iscsid.conf on how "authmethod" attribute used

Just adding comments about authmethod being mostly ignored.
No functional change.

* Add comment for deprecated authmethod handling.

Just added a "FIXNE" comment, to be consistent.

commit.message:
iscsid: Rescan devices on relogin (#444)

If a device goes to offline/transport-offline when we are disconnected
the device's size can be set to zero if some other app forces it to get
rescanned. Normally in the kernel when a device is set from offline to
running again, it will rescan the device. However, because during a
relogin the iscsi layer sets the state from offline/transport-offline
via iscsi_unblock_session we don't hit that rescan. We actually don't
want to hit the kernel's rescan right now, because it can block and
that would block all iscsid operations.

This has us perform a rescan operation after a relogin from the scan
process.

verification.payload:
tree f03b2fb0e9f6ef0e058d9202820a4fa14a958acc
parent 95f01ef60583ad378b5718ee664d176cbe085211
author mikechristie <1063316+mikechristie@users.noreply.github.com> 1712079569 -0500
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1712079569 -0700

iscsid: Rescan devices on relogin (#444)

If a device goes to offline/transport-offline when we are disconnected
the device's size can be set to zero if some other app forces it to get
rescanned. Normally in the kernel when a device is set from offline to
running again, it will rescan the device. However, because during a
relogin the iscsi layer sets the state from offline/transport-offline
via iscsi_unblock_session we don't hit that rescan. We actually don't
want to hit the kernel's rescan right now, because it can block and
that would block all iscsid operations.

This has us perform a rescan operation after a relogin from the scan
process.

commit.message:
Stop using deprecated inet_aton and inet_ntoa (#435)

The use of inet_aton is in usr/icsi_net_util.c, and
the use of inet_ntoa is in iscsiuio/src/...
Use the modern versions, inet_pton and inet_ntop,
which support IPv6, are used instead, but they
require a buffer. See open-iscsi issue# 433.

verification.payload:
tree 124f7dd6ee1bff2be1a4ccad4729bbdf68248b7a
parent a65a472a35b436c7a2d47c5862aae530ac4ae9c8
author Lee Duncan <lduncan@suse.com> 1703094910 -0800
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1703094910 -0800

Stop using deprecated inet_aton and inet_ntoa (#435)

The use of inet_aton is in usr/icsi_net_util.c, and
the use of inet_ntoa is in iscsiuio/src/...
Use the modern versions, inet_pton and inet_ntop,
which support IPv6, are used instead, but they
require a buffer. See open-iscsi issue# 433.

commit.message:
iscsiuio: manage threads better at shutdown (#428)

* iscsiuio: manage threads better at shutdown

This commit adds ability for iscsiuio to count
threads started, and to wait for them at shutdown,
up to 10 seconds maximum. It also adds a few
messages during that shutdown time if threads are
slow to shut down.

Testing showed that 100 iterations of stop/start
of the iscsiuio service completed without error
with these changes.

Signed-off-by: David Bond <dbond@suse.com>

* iscsiuio: make shutdown loop more efficient

Base on comments from Chris Leech, update the
shutdown loop so that it does not have to sleep
for one second unless there are threads still
in process.

Also, change the warning message about a
negative count to a debug message.
---------
Signed-off-by: David Bond <dbond@suse.com>

verification.payload:
tree f1ef99f25fb212500c6e71a08ae7af106369acaa
parent 079ae8723dcf41529f29e2e0ec9cc696fb653a0a
author Lee Duncan <lduncan@suse.com> 1698253668 -0700
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1698253668 -0700

iscsiuio: manage threads better at shutdown (#428)

* iscsiuio: manage threads better at shutdown

This commit adds ability for iscsiuio to count
threads started, and to wait for them at shutdown,
up to 10 seconds maximum. It also adds a few
messages during that shutdown time if threads are
slow to shut down.

Testing showed that 100 iterations of stop/start
of the iscsiuio service completed without error
with these changes.

Signed-off-by: David Bond <dbond@suse.com>

* iscsiuio: make shutdown loop more efficient

Base on comments from Chris Leech, update the
shutdown loop so that it does not have to sleep
for one second unless there are threads still
in process.

Also, change the warning message about a
negative count to a debug message.
---------
Signed-off-by: David Bond <dbond@suse.com>

commit.message:
Iscsiuio fixes v2 (#427)

* iscsiuio: when handling signals log all of them

Signed-off-by: David Bond <dbond@suse.com>

* iscsiuio: fix formatting '%D' -> '%d'

Fix a LOG_WARN() formatting error.

Signed-off-by: David Bond <dbond@suse.com>

* iscsiuio: fix mispelling: assoicate* -> associate*

Fix several mispellings, some in function names,
most in comments. No functional change.

Signed-off-by: David Bond <dbond@suse.com>

* iscsiuio: change parse_iface() to non-cancelable

This is because this thread holds the nic_list_mutex for
quite a while, so this avoids the mutex being orphanced.

Signed-off-by: David Bond <dbond@suse.com>

* iscsiuio: fix possible logging dealocks

The logging thread can be cancelled while holding
a logging mutex, so ensure that doesn't happen.

Testing shows this eliminated some hangs from mutex deadlock.

Signed-off-by: David Bond <dbond@suse.com>

* iscsiuio: release waiting thread NL when cancelling

This can prevent a mutex deadlock.

Signed-off-by: David Bond <dbond@suse.com>

* iscsiuio: change NL socket receive to have a timeout

This avoids a possible deadlock situations by making the
receive from the netlink socket time out after 1 second
if no data is received, at which point it loops and tries
again. Logging is also slightly modified to avoid a
storm of timeout messages.

Testing showed many successful repititions of service
start/stop without error with this change.

Signed-off-by: David Bond <dbond@suse.com>

* iscsiuio: signal success on exit, and close NL socket

Two small cleanups which help shutdown more cleanly. First,
exit with success if we are sucessful. Second, close (with
no-linger) the netlink socket when we are done with it.

* iscsiuio: remove unused logging statistics

These were not being used, so just remove them.

* iscsiuio: stop logging to file and stdout

This was redundant in the name of being more helpful,
but doubled the load on the daemon for some types of
logging, since it wrote to and flushed both the file
pointer and stdout for each debug message.

* iscsiuio: fix IPv4 address parsing for qedi

When scanning an IPv4 IP address for qedi adapters,
we expect 6 tuples, but check for one, printing an
incorrect error message in every case:

>	NIC-NAME: Could not parse mac_addr

Also, improve the error message while here.

Found-by: David Bond <DBond@suse.com>

* iscsiuio: rename logging macros using ILOG_*()

This change is in preperation for using syslog
for logging, should we decide to do that, since
syslog uses LOG_*() macro names. So rename ours
to ILOG_*(), to be less confusing.

Also, while modifying the logging lines, go
ahead and fix formatting strings to be on
one line, if possible.

No functional change.

* iscsiuio: more logging cleanup

Just removing some extra spaces, where not needed

* iscsiuio: use syslog for logging

This is a multi-threaded daemon, so rolling
our own logging was difficult, particularly
with respect to locking, which tended to get
deadlocked when shutting down. Just use syslog,
since it's engineered for that.

Note that for foreground mode, we now print
just to stdout, or stderr for error messages.
For background mode, we now use syslog().

* iscsiuio: add comment about using SO_LINGER

Has no functional effect.

---------

Signed-off-by: David Bond <dbond@suse.com>

verification.payload:
tree aaa7d8eae4374cac5088bba80be0758522a6175a
parent 11bdc17938ba648c81a853355a6bbddad69a9fc7
author Lee Duncan <lduncan@suse.com> 1697235668 -0700
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1697235668 -0700

Iscsiuio fixes v2 (#427)

* iscsiuio: when handling signals log all of them

Signed-off-by: David Bond <dbond@suse.com>

* iscsiuio: fix formatting '%D' -> '%d'

Fix a LOG_WARN() formatting error.

Signed-off-by: David Bond <dbond@suse.com>

* iscsiuio: fix mispelling: assoicate* -> associate*

Fix several mispellings, some in function names,
most in comments. No functional change.

Signed-off-by: David Bond <dbond@suse.com>

* iscsiuio: change parse_iface() to non-cancelable

This is because this thread holds the nic_list_mutex for
quite a while, so this avoids the mutex being orphanced.

Signed-off-by: David Bond <dbond@suse.com>

* iscsiuio: fix possible logging dealocks

The logging thread can be cancelled while holding
a logging mutex, so ensure that doesn't happen.

Testing shows this eliminated some hangs from mutex deadlock.

Signed-off-by: David Bond <dbond@suse.com>

* iscsiuio: release waiting thread NL when cancelling

This can prevent a mutex deadlock.

Signed-off-by: David Bond <dbond@suse.com>

* iscsiuio: change NL socket receive to have a timeout

This avoids a possible deadlock situations by making the
receive from the netlink socket time out after 1 second
if no data is received, at which point it loops and tries
again. Logging is also slightly modified to avoid a
storm of timeout messages.

Testing showed many successful repititions of service
start/stop without error with this change.

Signed-off-by: David Bond <dbond@suse.com>

* iscsiuio: signal success on exit, and close NL socket

Two small cleanups which help shutdown more cleanly. First,
exit with success if we are sucessful. Second, close (with
no-linger) the netlink socket when we are done with it.

* iscsiuio: remove unused logging statistics

These were not being used, so just remove them.

* iscsiuio: stop logging to file and stdout

This was redundant in the name of being more helpful,
but doubled the load on the daemon for some types of
logging, since it wrote to and flushed both the file
pointer and stdout for each debug message.

* iscsiuio: fix IPv4 address parsing for qedi

When scanning an IPv4 IP address for qedi adapters,
we expect 6 tuples, but check for one, printing an
incorrect error message in every case:

>	NIC-NAME: Could not parse mac_addr

Also, improve the error message while here.

Found-by: David Bond <DBond@suse.com>

* iscsiuio: rename logging macros using ILOG_*()

This change is in preperation for using syslog
for logging, should we decide to do that, since
syslog uses LOG_*() macro names. So rename ours
to ILOG_*(), to be less confusing.

Also, while modifying the logging lines, go
ahead and fix formatting strings to be on
one line, if possible.

No functional change.

* iscsiuio: more logging cleanup

Just removing some extra spaces, where not needed

* iscsiuio: use syslog for logging

This is a multi-threaded daemon, so rolling
our own logging was difficult, particularly
with respect to locking, which tended to get
deadlocked when shutting down. Just use syslog,
since it's engineered for that.

Note that for foreground mode, we now print
just to stdout, or stderr for error messages.
For background mode, we now use syslog().

* iscsiuio: add comment about using SO_LINGER

Has no functional effect.

---------

Signed-off-by: David Bond <dbond@suse.com>

commit.message:
usr/idbm.c: fix musl build (#426)

Fix the following musl build failure raised since version 2.1.9 and
https://github.com/open-iscsi/open-iscsi/commit/7b571d76d6937a78c141630fc38c3c57c532466c:

../usr/idbm.c: In function 'idbm_rec_write_old':
../usr/idbm.c:2230:27: error: 'GLOB_ONLYDIR' undeclared (first use in this function)
 2230 |         rc = glob(portal, GLOB_ONLYDIR, NULL, &globbuf);
      |                           ^~~~~~~~~~~~

Fixes:
 - http://autobuild.buildroot.org/results/14fc1c139f055b5b1eaa6e04e327863c06176a7b

Signed-off-by: Fabrice Fontaine <fontaine.fabrice@gmail.com>

author Fabrice Fontaine <fontaine.fabrice@gmail.com> 1696454300 +0200
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1696454300 -0700

https://github.com/open-iscsi/open-iscsi/commit/7b571d76d6937a78c141630fc38c3c57c532466c:

../usr/idbm.c: In function 'idbm_rec_write_old':
../usr/idbm.c:2230:27: error: 'GLOB_ONLYDIR' undeclared (first use in this function)
 2230 |         rc = glob(portal, GLOB_ONLYDIR, NULL, &globbuf);

commit.message:
remove unicode symbol from iscsid.conf (#423)

Trivial fixup.  I ran into a test script that failed becuase iscsid.conf
wasn't ASCII.  I like UTF-8, but none of this code handles it. And while
unicode bytes in a comment shouldn't be the end of the world, it's just
a lot clearer to remove the single offending symbol.

Signed-off-by: Chris Leech <cleech@redhat.com>

verification.payload:
tree dafcad5923c9136134ca1f5a3064355499d290b7
parent c26218d9f8afdca44a492a4c3811648bd2880b26
author Chris Leech <cleech@redhat.com> 1688662341 -0700
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1688662341 -0700

remove unicode symbol from iscsid.conf (#423)

Trivial fixup.  I ran into a test script that failed becuase iscsid.conf
wasn't ASCII.  I like UTF-8, but none of this code handles it. And while
unicode bytes in a comment shouldn't be the end of the world, it's just

commit.message:
iscsiuio: update version to 0.7.8.7

Signed-off-by: Nilesh Javali <njavali@marvell.com>

iscsiuio: fix corrupted unsorted chunks while freeing memory

While iscsiuio service stops, removal of all nics
causes iscsiuio to crash,

iscsiuio[50077]: free(): corrupted unsorted chunks

Correct the deletion of nic from nic_list.

Signed-off-by: Nilesh Javali <njavali@marvell.com>

iscsiuio: validate nic interface associated with qedi

While the iscsiuio service stops, nic_loop is
engaged in processing the packets for qedi causing
iscsiuio to crash,

iscsiuio[49684]: segfault at 70 ip 000055ef1055ce91
		 sp 00007f9046ffcce0
		 error 4 in iscsiuio[55ef10543000+28000]

While processing the read packets, validate if the
nic interface has been freed or still associated with
the qedi.

Signed-off-by: Nilesh Javali <njavali@marvell.com>
Spelling fixes

Remove incorrect "BindTo" line in iscsiuio.service (#415)

The correct syntax is "BindsTo", but we do not
actually want to use this, because it would imply
that iscsid.service needs to be started _before_
iscsiuio.service, but that is backwards.

Found by: Martin Wilck @ SUSE

verification.payload:
tree f6f8149a43f559c4095fa71cb118ecddf441ebba
parent f3c53e0bd2198b0a851698cf794ff9edd50720cf
author Lee Duncan <lduncan@suse.com> 1682702102 -0700
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1682702102 -0700

Remove incorrect "BindTo" line in iscsiuio.service (#415)

The correct syntax is "BindsTo", but we do not
actually want to use this, because it would imply
that iscsid.service needs to be started _before_
iscsiuio.service, but that is backwards.

Found by: Martin Wilck @ SUSE

commit.message:
Build: make open-isns usage optional. (#407)

* Build: make open-isns usage optional.

In some cases open-isns may not be needed or may not
be available. Make building without it optional, using
meson. The depricated Makefile build is not effected.

* Build: ensure "make" enables iSNS support

Even though "make" is deprecated, it's still here,
so make sure it enables iSNS support, since that is what
it has always done. If somebody wants to make iSNS
optional for "make", they can do so.

* Build: clean up how iSNS library is used.

The functionality stays the same, but the meson.build
file is a little easier to understand this way.

Suggested by: Eli Schwartz

* build: clean up comments for isns lib detection

verification.payload:
tree 6d90a0daa7b1d7b2929965cfcf7a92549e912587
parent 5ad0943d86816a6a95c3775301491d4d2eb77839
author Lee Duncan <lduncan@suse.com> 1682008407 -0700
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1682008407 -0700

Build: make open-isns usage optional. (#407)

* Build: make open-isns usage optional.

In some cases open-isns may not be needed or may not
be available. Make building without it optional, using
meson. The depricated Makefile build is not effected.

* Build: ensure "make" enables iSNS support

Even though "make" is deprecated, it's still here,
so make sure it enables iSNS support, since that is what
it has always done. If somebody wants to make iSNS
optional for "make", they can do so.

* Build: clean up how iSNS library is used.

The functionality stays the same, but the meson.build
file is a little easier to understand this way.

Suggested by: Eli Schwartz

* build: clean up comments for isns lib detection

commit.message:
When writing DB record without a tpgt, take tpgt from existing record (#409)

* idmb_rec_write, check for tpgt first

Factor out the check for a tpgt to a single place, before going crazy on
the rec files.  Makes flow of this function easier to follow, and preps
for splitting it up.

Signed-off-by: Chris Leech <cleech@redhat.com>

* idbm_rec_write, seperate old and new style writes

Duplicates a small bit of code, but easier to understand and extened.

Signed-off-by: Chris Leech <cleech@redhat.com>

* idbm_rec_write, pick tpgt from existing record

On a static add (-m node -o new) without a user specified tpgt, looks
for existing new style records with tpgt before creating an old style
record without.  If one exists, take the tpgt from it an write an
updated new style record instead.

Signed-off-by: Chris Leech <cleech@redhat.com>

---------

Signed-off-by: Chris Leech <cleech@redhat.com>

verification.payload:
tree 371fd5f73004612ad938a0be37b704d014250ca8
parent 0838a2ef2db491ef04607f8ee12e98d540a4e82f
author Chris Leech <cleech@redhat.com> 1681776454 -0700
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1681776454 -0700

When writing DB record without a tpgt, take tpgt from existing record (#409)

* idmb_rec_write, check for tpgt first

Factor out the check for a tpgt to a single place, before going crazy on
the rec files.  Makes flow of this function easier to follow, and preps
for splitting it up.

Signed-off-by: Chris Leech <cleech@redhat.com>

* idbm_rec_write, seperate old and new style writes

Duplicates a small bit of code, but easier to understand and extened.

Signed-off-by: Chris Leech <cleech@redhat.com>

* idbm_rec_write, pick tpgt from existing record

On a static add (-m node -o new) without a user specified tpgt, looks
for existing new style records with tpgt before creating an old style
record without.  If one exists, take the tpgt from it an write an
updated new style record instead.

Signed-off-by: Chris Leech <cleech@redhat.com>

---------

Signed-off-by: Chris Leech <cleech@redhat.com>

commit.message:
Fix libopeniscsiusr licensing (#403)

* Fix libopeniscsiusr licensing

The library was licensed GLPv3, but LGPLv3 is more
appropriate for a library used widely by others.

The change is done with permission of the library
author, after some discussion.

This will effectively upgrade the license, in
practice, for open-iscsi, to GPLv3, without
having to actually change the higher-level license.

* Fixing libopeniscsiusr License: continued

Change License text in each source file to mention
that we are now using the "Lesser" GPL v3.

* Add license info to the README file

Add a section to the top-level section in the
README file about the license of open-iscsi and
that of libopeniscsiusr.

commit.message:
Remove unused SLP discovery code (#401)

Support for SLP Discovery of targets was never full implemented,
and likely won't be any time soon by this project, so remove
the code that was designed to support it.

Note that this removal does not include the code for
NFS SLP, which is a different beast, and left unchanged.

Remove unused SLP discovery code (#401)

Support for SLP Discovery of targets was never full implemented,
and likely won't be any time soon by this project, so remove
the code that was designed to support it.

Note that this removal does not include the code for
NFS SLP, which is a different beast, and left unchanged.

commit.message:
Make UID the default auth type for IPCs (#404)

Modern security practices include checking the originating UID
of an IPC. But not the username, as there are many valid scenarios
where a user database may not exist or the root account may not be
explicitly named "root".

The mode to check UID and username is still functional, but is now
on the path to deprecation. Related function names and enums now
include the term "legacy" to indicate this deprecated status.

The 'iscsid.ipc_auth_uid' setting in iscsid.config now defaults to
'Yes', rather than introducing a new key. Users sometimes keep old
config files when upgrading packages, and this ensures behavior
remains the same if this setting was explicitly defined in an old
config.

Reviewed-by: Mike Christie <michael.christie@oracle.com>
Signed-off-by: Eric Mackay <eric.mackay@oracle.com>

verification.payload:
tree 1eda02c54316cbf90e2037abb09fd02128a71f71
parent c4c0c14692f31d5b4f4b4d5e899ed73de1193693
author Eric Mackay <eric.mackay@oracle.com> 1678992786 -0700
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1678992786 -0700

Make UID the default auth type for IPCs (#404)

Modern security practices include checking the originating UID
of an IPC. But not the username, as there are many valid scenarios
where a user database may not exist or the root account may not be
explicitly named "root".

The mode to check UID and username is still functional, but is now
on the path to deprecation. Related function names and enums now
include the term "legacy" to indicate this deprecated status.

The 'iscsid.ipc_auth_uid' setting in iscsid.config now defaults to
'Yes', rather than introducing a new key. Users sometimes keep old
config files when upgrading packages, and this ensures behavior
remains the same if this setting was explicitly defined in an old
config.

Reviewed-by: Mike Christie <michael.christie@oracle.com>
Signed-off-by: Eric Mackay <eric.mackay@oracle.com>

commit.message:
Small cleanup (#399)

* Cleanup discovery.c source file

No functional changes. Cleaning up the file in anticipation
of making iSNS and SLP discovery optional. Cleanups:
* Remove SLP_ENABLE ifdef, since it was never used and could not compile
* Remove "if 0" code, also never used
* Reformatting:
  - Convert spaces to tabs for format alignment
  - Remove spaces at end of line
  - Convert strings on multiple lines to one line (for better searching)
  - Align multi-line function arguments consistently

* Build: rearrange meson options file

No functional change. Moving around options in anticipation
of adding new options for iSNS and/or SLP support.
